page.title: 16THE VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: Sutton C.of E.School opened in 1877 and now houses the 24 Junior children. The 19 Infants use the Village Institute which is partitioned into the classroom and the hall/dining room. There are two full_time teachers and one nine hours. The school has no playing field and only a small playground. The children are taken to swimming baths in Thirsk once a week, parents providing the transport. Toilets are outside and there is very little in the way of washing facilities. School dinners for 21 children are cooked on the premises the remainder of the children bring packed lunch. In 1985 there are 22 children from Sutton itself the remaining 21 come from the nearby villages of Bagby, Boltby,Felixkirk,Kilburn and Thirlby.
